titleStmt.title: H.W. Hull v. Washington Territory. Order Granting Writ.

bibl.title: H.W. Hull v. Washington Territory. Order Granting Writ.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.ab: In the District Court Holding Terms at Seattle, Wash. Ter.
The People of the United States of America To the Sheriff of King County Greeting,
div1.p: We command you, that you have the body of HW Hull by you imprisoned and detained as it is said, together with the time and cause at such imprisonment and detention by whatsoever name said H.W. Hull shall be called or charged, before the Hon. Roger S. Greene, Judge of the aforesaid court at the court noon in the city of Seattle W.T. before R.S. Greene Chief Judge of the Supreme Court, to do and recieve what shall then and there be considered concerning the said H.W. Hull and the detention and imprisonment aforesaid and have you then and there this writ.
div1.ab: Witness the Hon. Roger S. Greene Judge of said District Court and the Seal thereof this 21 day of April A.D. 1884
